details.regulation: Decree No. 43/2017/ND-CP on Goods Labels, Circular No. 05/2019/TT-BYT & Circular No. 11/2021/TT-BYT on Nutritional Labeling
details.article: Decree 43 Article 10 (Mandatory contents of goods labels); Circular 05/2019/TT-BYT Article 5 (Allergen information is voluntarily declared)
details.reason: While not explicitly mandated as major allergens, common allergens are generally recommended for declaration on food labels as part of food safety information to protect sensitive consumers.
details.note: Vietnam does not have a comprehensive list of 'major food allergens' with mandatory labeling similar to the US or Japan. Allergen information is often provided voluntarily or as part of general food safety and nutritional labeling guidelines. Future regulations may introduce a mandatory list.
